Dear all,

We are pleased to inform you that the 8th Tzu Chi Global Symposium for Common Goodness on "Economic Justice and Environmental Sustainability" will be jointly hosted by the Tzu Chi Foundation, National Chengchi University, Tang Prize Foundation, and Storm Media Group on August 3rd, 2023. The event details are attached to this email.

We invite all interested participants to register directly through the following website: https://pse.is/52wv9k. Please note that the registration deadline is July 31st, 2023.

Dear all,

Please be informed that the Taiwan Institute for Sustainable Energy and the CTCI Education Foundation will be hosting the "2023 Sustainable Development Goals Teacher Empowerment Camp - Summer Session" on August 19, 2023 (Saturday).

This event is free of charge, and the registration period is from today until August 13, 2023 (Sunday). For event details and registration information, please visit https://taise.org.tw/events-view.php?ID=381.

Call For Papers

The 1st Pacific Rim International Conference on the Dream of the Red Chamber


The "International Research Center of the Dream of the Red Chamber" of the College of Humanities and Social Sciences at National Dong Hwa University was established in 2022. In celebration of its first anniversary, and to promote international cultural and academic exchanges, in-depth research on classic literature, the first "The 1st Pacific Rim International Conference on the Dream of the Red Chamber" is scheduled to be held on November 23-24, 2023 (Thursday and Friday). Scholars from home and abroad are invited to participate, and share research results. We welcome Chinese young scholars from all over the world to submit papers and attend the conference.


â€»Call for Papersï¼š

â—Eligibility: Master's and doctoral students in the field of "Dream of the Red Chamber" related studies.

â—The conference invites expert scholars to review the submitted papers. Those who pass the first round of review will be invited to write a full paper and participate in the conference.

â—In addition to peer review, the association also invites experts and senior scholars in the academic community to serve as members of the review committee and guest discussants.

â—The papers that are accepted and presented at the conference will be collected and published as a conference proceeding after the event.

â—Important dates:

(1) Abstract submission deadline: June 30, 2023. The abstract should be 500-1000 Chinese characters in length.
(2) Announcement of accepted abstracts: July 30, 2023 (Friday)
(3) Full paper submission deadline: October 27, 2023 (Friday). The paper should be around 15,000 Chinese characters, with a maximum of 20,000 characters. (The writing format should follow the guidelines of the " Chinese-Literature-Philosophy-Institute Bulletin, SINICA")

Please submit your paper with the " Abstract Submission Form" attached and send it to rdrc@gms.ndhu.edu.tw

We sincerely welcome Master's and PhD students in the field of Chinese literature, history, and philosophy from around the world to actively submit papers.

Host organization: International Research Center of the Dream of the Red Chamber, National Dong Hwa University.
